Text: ...Is that all of it?
Yeah.

And you didn't leave any traces except the ones
belonging to the basilisk?
You bet—
Hissss...!
Huh?!

Do you know why I waited until you were done
stealing?
Wh-Who're you?!

You see...it makes the clean-up process a whole lot
easier to know what was stolen from where!
Aghhh!!!
Huh...?! Wh-What the hell was that?!
...I fired a magic slash.

Well, it's not something just anyone can do, so it's
understandable you're surprised.
(A midranged attack with a magic slash—)

(I was wondering if I could pull it off, but I
actually did it!)

(The core training lessons have also helped regulate
the circulation of magic in my body and stabilize my
magic activation!)

(...But firing at something without thinking drains
my magic aggressively...as well as my magic
defenses!)
I can't believe we missed this guard... Take her out!
*gasp*

(Not good... I'm highly vulnerable to its gaze
without my magic defenses fully equipped!)

(It's not just a matter of avoiding its gaze. As long
as it's looking at me, it's almost impossible to
evade.)
Ack...!

Now that you've seen me, I can't just let you go
nighty-night. You know...I think I'll have a little
fun with you before I kill you.
Ugh! That's disgusting...!

I'll silence that insolent tongue of yours! Basilisk,
work your magic on this brat!
Well, as long as it's looking my way...!
Hisssss?!

Heheh... You look surprised that the basilisk's gaze
had no effect on me.

The magic of the basilisk's gaze directly hit my
body, but I deflected it...with the sound waves
carrying my magic.

The light that forms the gaze and the ambience that
forms the sound both contain magic that interferes
with each other.
Wh-What kinda logic is that?! It makes no sense!
Heh... This is my parting gift to you.

(I just spouted a bunch of random stuff that sounds
plausible, but maybe that's actually how it works!)
...Playtime is over!
Hisssssssss!!!
Aaaagghh!

Since it's aggressively draining, I just have to
increase the number of targets I take out with a
single slash.

I'll try this approach and method until I learn to
fire them consistently.

...You know, that really did the job of easing the
tension in my shoulders! Looks like I'll be able to
sleep soundly and be in perfect form for tomorrow's
party!
I've never seen that pianist before...

What an exquisite melody... Who is she? Where is she
from? She would make a wonderful pianist in residence
for my—

Well, you'll have to get in line! I'm the one who
spotted her first!
Shhh! Quiet now! Let us focus on the performance.

Heheh. Well said, Master Marco. You really do know
how to handle the ladies.

But really...what a lovely melody. Although it's
midday, I feel as if I'm basking in the moonlight.
...Looks like it's settled.

Alongside our company's tea, it appears the other
talk of the party and show-stealer is the wandering
pianist Shiron.
A new star is born!
Hm-hmmm~♪ Hm-hmmm~♪
...You seem in high spirits, Epsilon.
Heheh... Can you tell?

I'm pretty sure anyone looking at you would be able
to tell.

Really...? Anyway, Master Shadow, I've prepared your
tea for today.
Right, thanks.

(Epsilon is great at making tea, and she can also
bake a mean dessert.)

(Unlike Zeta who's the type that excels at
everything on her first try, Epsilon's talent
and skills are more down to earth.)

Smells great... By the way, mind if I ask why you're
in such a good mood?
Yes!
...Oh, e-err...!
Why the sudden shyness?

Well, um, for some reason, I suddenly feel nervous
now that I have to say it out loud...!

(She was just happily humming "Moonlight Sonata" a
moment ago.)

(Well, amongst the Seven Shadows, Epsilon is
particularly shy and a little vain...)

(In other words, she's the type who values so-called
"feminine traits." It would be tactless for me to ask
too many questions.)

(Unlike my sister Claire who's unpredictable and can
lose her temper at a moment's notice, Epsilon clearly
knows how to respect other people's boundaries, so in
a sense, she's easy to handle.)
What is it?
Well, I learned to fire magic slashes!
Wow, not bad.
...You mean like this?
*gasp*

(...I just casually gave it a go, but I actually
pulled it off?)

(It might discourage the hard-working Epsilon if I
told her honestly. Guess I'll hide the truth in the
shadows and act like I'd learned to do it before.)

On the one hand, you don't want to be too stingy and
diminish your magic, but at the same time, you don't
want to deplete all your magic either... It's hard to
find a balance.

Very impressive, Master Shadow! I'll do my best to
improve mine!

Patience is a virtue, and good things come to those
who wait.

Ohh! Another piece of Shadow Wisdom! I shall take
your words to heart, Master Shadow!
